nodes.label: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) (400–700 nm)
nodes.description: Traditional definition of PAR encompassing photons from 400 to 700 nm, responsible for driving most photosynthesis measurements.

nodes.label: Far-red photons (701–750 nm)
nodes.description: Photons in the 701–750 nm range, shown to significantly contribute to photosynthesis, especially in shaded environments, accounting for 10–25% of leaf gross photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Leaf gross photosynthesis
nodes.description: Total photosynthetic carbon fixation rate in leaves, with contributions from various wavelengths, including 24–25% from far-red photons in sunlit conditions and 10–14% in shade.

nodes.label: Photosystem II (PSII)
nodes.description: Photosystem primarily excited by shorter wavelengths (400–700 nm), involved in water splitting and electron transport during photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Photosystem I (PSI)
nodes.description: Photosystem preferentially excited by far-red photons (>700 nm), plays a crucial role in cyclic electron flow and NADPH formation.

nodes.label: Synergistic interaction between far-red and shorter wavelengths
nodes.description: Combined excitation of PSI and PSII enhances overall photosynthetic efficiency, demonstrated in controlled experiments.

nodes.label: Photosynthetic efficiency
nodes.description: Measure of how effectively absorbed photons are converted into chemical energy; increased by the synergistic use of far-red and shorter wavelengths.

nodes.label: Shade environment
nodes.description: Low-light conditions where far-red photons can constitute over 50% of incident photons, significantly influencing photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Sunlit environment
nodes.description: High-light conditions where far-red photons contribute approximately 24–25% to leaf gross photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Photon excitation of PSI
nodes.description: Longer-wavelength photons (>700 nm) preferentially excite PSI, facilitating cyclic electron flow and energy distribution.

nodes.label: Photon excitation of PSII
nodes.description: Shorter-wavelength photons (400–700 nm) primarily excite PSII, initiating water splitting and electron transport.

nodes.label: Measurement models of photosynthesis
nodes.description: Current models often exclude photons >700 nm, leading to underestimation of actual photosynthesis, especially in canopy and shade conditions.

nodes.label: Ecosystem productivity
nodes.description: The rate of biomass production at the ecosystem level, influenced by accurate photosynthesis measurements including far-red photons.

nodes.label: Global carbon cycle
nodes.description: The exchange of carbon among the atmosphere, biosphere, and oceans, impacted by plant productivity and photosynthesis efficiency.

nodes.label: Climate change impacts
nodes.description: Alterations in light quality and quantity affecting photosynthesis, with far-red photons playing a significant role in plant responses.

nodes.label: Photosynthesis measurement techniques
nodes.description: Methods that should incorporate far-red wavelengths to accurately assess photosynthetic activity under natural conditions.

nodes.label: Crop improvement strategies
nodes.description: Breeding or engineering crops to optimize utilization of far-red photons for enhanced productivity.

nodes.label: Ecosystem carbon cycling
nodes.description: Process involving photosynthesis, respiration, and decomposition, influenced by the contribution of far-red photons to plant productivity.

nodes.label: Photosynthetic photon flux density (PPFD)
nodes.description: Quantitative measure of photon flux in the 400–700 nm range, which should be expanded to include 701–750 nm for accuracy.

nodes.label: Synergistic excitation of PSI and PSII
nodes.description: Concurrent excitation of both photosystems by different wavelength ranges enhances overall photosynthesis efficiency.
